intro: Bertolonia scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpion weed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a creeping habit with branched stems and produces small, clustered flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
